title: joy
comment: A quality or attitude of delight and happiness, which is ultimately grounded in the work of God as Father, Son and Holy Spirit. Among the many situations in which joy is experienced, Scripture recognises as supreme being accepted in the presence of God.

children.title: joy, of God
joy, of Jesus Christ
joy, of Holy Spirit
joy, and human experience
children.comment: Joy is experienced naturally in many circumstances of life and in human relationships. It is especially important in the life of God's people, who experience joy in response to all that God has done for them.

children.title: Poetic images of joy in creation
Joy arising from specific circumstances
Joy because of the birth of children
Joy because of victory and deliverance
Joy because of the behaviour of others
Joy because of God's blessings in everyday life
Joy arising from relationships
God's people find their joy in him
God himself gives joy to his people
Reasons for God's people to know joy
joy, of Israel
children.comment: Joy is characteristic of Israel's corporate worship, especially the great festivals.

children.title: Joy expressed in and through Israel's life of worship
Joy expressed by the individual as a result of faith
Joy experienced by the nation as the people of God
Joy predicted in prophetic assurances of restoration and blessing
Joy at times of national celebration
The anointing of kings
The consecration of the temple
Consecration of the temple in the reign of King Hezekiah
Deliverance of the Jews through Queen Esther
The rebuilding of the temple and Jerusalem
Other nations encouraged to share Israel's joy
joy, of the church
children.comment: The church is to rejoice in the salvation brought about by Jesus Christ's faithful life and death, and by the power of his resurrection. Even in adversity, believers know the joy of Jesus Christ.

Joy experienced even in adversity

Joy because of the believers' faith and obedience
Joy because of the believers' love and concern

seealsos.comment: the Philippians' love for one another

children.title: Joy because of the believers' partnership in the gospel
